articles.title: About this site and me
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
LLoRR Stats
          
          
          MetaReport
          MatchUps
          Meta
          Analysis
          Resources
          About
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              About this site and me
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        RPubs
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            Everything is collected with Riot’s API. It’s still a
            development key so the amount of data I can scrap is quite
            limited.
            All data is assumed to be almost always from players at
            Master ranks. When a new player is added to the leaderboard
            I start searching their match-history, since the Riot API
            return the last 20 matches without any other metadata of a
            match, initially I may recover some matches from Diamond
            too, but from that point onward those games are in Master
            ranks.
            All results are aimed at Master rank: play rate and win
            rate are relative to the reference population and results at
            lower ranks may differ. For Plat+
            Kozmic and
            Dr.Lor provide
            better (and more consolidated) data.
            At the start of a season I may recover all games played
            at Master but once my rate-limit is less than the average
            number of games played, my approach is to extract a random
            sample of games played in the current patch. I won’t give
            priority to the most recent games or I may easily create
            bias in the sample.
            
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              About this site and me
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      Twitter
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      RPubs
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      Email
                    
                  
                                  
              
            
            
              Everything is collected with Riot’s API. It’s still a
              development key so the amount of data I can scrap is quite
              limited.
              All data is assumed to be almost always from players
              at Master ranks. When a new player is added to the
              leaderboard I start searching their match-history, since
              the Riot API return the last 20 matches without any other
              metadata of a match, initially I may recover some matches
              from Diamond too, but from that point onward those games
              are in Master ranks.
              All results are aimed at Master rank: play rate and
              win rate are relative to the reference population and
              results at lower ranks may differ. For Plat+
              Kozmic and
              Dr.Lor provide
              better (and more consolidated) data.
              At the start of a season I may recover all games
              played at Master but once my rate-limit is less than the
              average number of games played, my approach is to extract
              a random sample of games played in the current patch. I
              won’t give priority to the most recent games or I may
              easily create bias in the sample.
              
        
      
    

    
    
    
      © 2021 Vazzoler Valentino
      LlorR Stats was created under Riot Games’ “Legal Jibber Jabber”
      policy using assets owned by Riot Games. Riot Games does not endorse or
      sponsor this project.

articles.title: (Legna’s) Legends of Runeterra Stats (with R)
articles.description: Hi, Legna here. I you are looking for stats on the current metagame just click on MatchUps or Meta in the Navigation Bar.

articles.title: Resources
articles.description: Link to the tools I made
articles.contents:
{"x":{"tag":{"name":"Reactable","attribs":{"data":{"Project":["MatchUps","Bo3-Helper","Decks Codes/Structures"],"url":["https://www.llorr-stats.com/static/mu.html","https://legnavv.shinyapps.io/Bo3-helper/","https://www.llorr-stats.com/static/meta.html"],"Description":["Match Ups data that cover the same (current) cycle of buff/nerfs.","Helper for Bo3. As of now it's rarely updated because I need to remake it.","Dashboard with Meta or Underdog Decks' Most played decklist and playrates over time"]},"columns":[{"accessor":"Project","name":"Project","type":"character","cell":[{"name":"a","attribs":{"href":"https://www.llorr-stats.com/static/mu.html"},"children":["MatchUps"]},{"name":"a","attribs":{"href":"https://legnavv.shinyapps.io/Bo3-helper/"},"children":["Bo3-Helper"]},{"name":"a","attribs":{"href":"https://www.llorr-stats.com/static/meta.html"},"children":["Decks Codes/Structures"]}],"minWidth":150},{"accessor":"url","name":"url","type":["glue","character"],"show":false},{"accessor":"Description","name":"Description","type":"character","minWidth":250}],"defaultPageSize":3,"paginationType":"numbers","showPageInfo":true,"minRows":1,"theme":{"backgroundColor":"whitesmoke","borderColor":"#dfe2e5","stripedColor":"#f6f8fa","highlightColor":"#f0f5f9","cellPadding":"8px 12px","style":{"fontFamily":"-apple-system, Lato, sans-serif"}},"dataKey":"9261499e2c7fbafa5b1c20aa0e75a745","key":"9261499e2c7fbafa5b1c20aa0e75a745"},"children":[]},"class":"reactR_markup"},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}
Credits to Tom
Mock for showing how to fully bring out the distill package
potential.
Regarding the Bo3-Helper, as it requires a server to work and the one
I’m using have limited of available hrs it may not be always up. To
solve this I would need to pay for a server and yeah it may be a
problem… in case if I have enough support…I can invest on it. There’s a
buymeacofee (~patreon) link in the menu if one wants to help me.
